name: getbodypartvalues
description:
This is a sub-function API for tool the_cancer_imaging_archive.
Tool description: NOTE: You need an API-Key to use this API. See README for more details.
The Cancer Imaging Archive (TCIA) is a public repository of cancer images and related clinical data for the express purpose of enabling open science research. Currently over 26 million radiologic images of cancer are contained in this repository. The API allows you to query metadata and download images from the various public collections available on TCIA
API description: Gets a set of all body part names filtered by optional query parameters.

format.description: Specifies the output type. Allowed values are CSV, HTML, XML, or JSON. Default is None.

collection.description: A label used to name a set of images collected for a specific trial or other reason. Assigned during the process of curating the data. Default is None.

bodypartexamined.description: A standard DICOM definition for the body part examined (0018x0015). Default is None.

modality.description: A standard DICOM definition for the imaging modality used (0008x0060). Default is None.
